name: Vorpal Sword
flavour: The blade hums with an eager, almost hungry resonance. Its edge exists in a state of impossible sharpness—legends say it was folded in the space between moments, tempered in the silence before thunder.
description:
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the weapon ignores resistance to slashing damage.

**Vorpal Strike**
When you attack a creature that has at least one head with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the DM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon.

**Severing Edge**
Critical hits with this weapon deal an additional 6d8 slashing damage.

name: Holy Avenger
flavour: The blade radiates a warmth that speaks of dawn breaking over ancient battlefields. Its crossguard bears the wings of celestial messengers, and when drawn in righteous cause, it blazes with holy fire.
description:
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a fiend or an undead with it, that creature takes an extra 2d10 radiant damage.

**Aura of Protection**
While you hold the drawn sword, it creates an aura in a 10-foot radius around you. You and all creatures friendly to you in the aura have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

**Divine Conduit**
If you have 17 or more levels in the paladin class, the radius of the aura increases to 30 feet.

name: Staff of Power
properties: Versatile (1d8), requires attunement by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
flavour: Crystalline veins pulse with arcane energy along the staff's length, converging at a headpiece that seems to drink in ambient light. The wood itself is warm to the touch, thrumming with barely contained power.
description:
This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

**Power Strike**
When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 1d6 force damage to the target.

**Spells**
The staff has 20 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells: cone of cold (5 charges), fireball (5th-level, 5 charges), globe of invulnerability (6 charges), hold monster (5 charges), levitate (2 charges), lightning bolt (5th-level, 5 charges), magic missile (1 charge), ray of enfeeblement (1 charge), or wall of force (5 charges).

**Retributive Strike**
You can break the staff as an action, releasing its magic in an explosion.

name: Cloak of Invisibility
flavour: The fabric seems woven from twilight itself—neither fully present nor absent. When still, it might be mistaken for a shadow; when moving, it bends light around itself like water around a stone.
description:
While wearing this cloak, you can pull its hood over your head to cause yourself to become invisible. While you are invisible, anything you are carrying or wearing is invisible with you. You become visible when you cease wearing the hood. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

**Deduct Time**
The cloak can be used for a total of 2 hours, all at once or in increments of 1 minute. After 2 hours of use, the cloak ceases to function. For every uninterrupted period of 12 hours the cloak goes unused, it regains 1 hour of duration.

name: Flame Tongue Longsword
flavour: The steel carries an inner fire that never quite dies—even sheathed, the blade is warm to the touch. When the command word is spoken, flames race along its edge like eager hounds released from a leash.
description:
You can use a bonus action to speak this magic sword's command word, causing flames to erupt from the blade. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet. While the sword is ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage to any target it hits. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the sword.

**Illumination**
The flames provide both tactical advantage and practical light source, revealing hidden enemies and dark passages alike.

name: Amulet of Health
flavour: A deep red gem pulses with a rhythm that matches—then steadies—your heartbeat. Ancient healers called these 'vitality stones,' claiming they anchor the soul more firmly to the body.
description:
Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it.

**Fortified Vitality**
The amulet's magic reinforces your physical resilience, granting the Constitution of a trained warrior regardless of your natural constitution.

name: Ioun Stone (Protection)
flavour: This dusty rose prism orbits your head in slow, deliberate circuits. It seems almost aware—dodging grasping hands and weaving between sword strokes as if it shares your survival instinct.
description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy. When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you.

**Protection**
You gain a +1 bonus to AC while this dusty rose prism orbits your head.

**Vulnerability**
Another creature can use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check.

name: Ring of Protection
flavour: Delicate silver bands interweave in an endless knot, the pattern shifting subtly when danger approaches. Those who wear it speak of a constant, gentle pressure—like an unseen hand ready to deflect.
description:
You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while wearing this ring.

**Warding Magic**
The ring's protective enchantment extends beyond mere physical defence, bolstering your resistance to magical effects and environmental hazards alike.

name: Dagger of Venom
flavour: The blade weeps a single black tear that never quite falls. Serpentine patterns etched into the steel seem to writhe in torchlight, and the handle is wrapped in snakeskin that's cool to the touch.
description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

**Poison**
You can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat the blade. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The dagger can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Potion of Invisibility
flavour: The liquid inside this vial is perfectly clear—so clear that the vial appears empty until tilted. It tastes of nothing and leaves no sensation, as if you'd swallowed pure absence.
description: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink it, you become invisible for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is invisible with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

name: Wand of Magic Missiles
description:
This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the magic missile spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Helm of Telepathy
description:
While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the detect thoughts spell (save DC 13) from it. As long as you maintain concentration on the spell, you can use a bonus action to send a telepathic message to a creature you are focused on.

The creature can reply telepathically. While focusing on a creature with detect thoughts, you can use an action to cast the suggestion spell (save DC 13) from the helm on that creature. Once used, the suggestion property can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
description: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 19 or higher without them.

name: Cloak of Protection
description: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

name: Cloak of Elvenkind
description: While you wear this cloak with its hood up, Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

name: Bag of Holding
description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents.

Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action. If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane.

name: Greatsword +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Decanter of Endless Water
description:
This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds.

You can use an action to remove the stopper and speak one of three command words:
- **Stream**: 1 gallon of water per round
- **Fountain**: 5 gallons of water per round
- **Geyser**: 30 gallons of water per round (can push creatures)

name: Bracers of Archery
description: While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the longbow and shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

name: Longbow +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Battleaxe +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Studded Leather +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Studded leather armor is made from tough but flexible leather, reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

name: Rapier +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Boots of Elvenkind
description: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on moving silently.

name: Lantern of Revealing
description: While lit, this hooded lantern burns for 6 hours on 1 pint of oil, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Invisible creatures and objects are visible as long as they are in the lantern's bright light. You can use an action to lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

name: Goggles of Night
description: While wearing these dark lenses, you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.

name: Chain Shirt +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor. Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather.

name: Shortsword +1
description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Shield +1
description: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

name: Rope of Climbing
description: This 60-foot length of silk rope weighs 3 pounds and can hold up to 3,000 pounds. If you hold one end of the rope and use an action to speak the command word, the rope animates. As a bonus action, you can command the other end to move toward a destination you choose. That end moves 10 feet on your turn when you first command it and 10 feet on each of your turns until reaching its destination, up to its maximum length away, or until you tell it to stop.

name: Potion of Greater Healing
description: You regain 4d4 + 4 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Potion of Healing
description: You regain 2d4 + 2 hit points when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Ball Bearings (Bag of 1000)
description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

name: Oathbow
flavour: Carved from the heartwood of a tree that witnessed an ancient betrayal, this bow remembers every broken promise. When you speak your oath against a foe, the wood creaks with anticipation—it hungers to see vows fulfilled.
description:
When you nock an arrow on this bow, it whispers in Elvish, 'Swift defeat to my enemies.' When you use this weapon to make a ranged attack, you can, as a command phrase, say, 'Swift death to you who have wronged me.' The target of your attack becomes your sworn enemy until it dies or until dawn seven days later.

**Sworn Enemy**
You have advantage on attack rolls against your sworn enemy, and your sworn enemy gains no benefit from cover (other than total cover). When you hit your sworn enemy with this weapon, it takes an extra 3d6 piercing damage.

**Single Focus**
While your sworn enemy lives, you have disadvantage on attack rolls with all other weapons.

name: Bow of Warning
flavour: The bowstring hums with a frequency just below hearing—a constant vigilance that seeps into your bones. Those who carry it sleep lighter, dream sharper, and are never truly caught unaware.
description:
You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

**Warning**
While this weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be surprised, except when incapacitated by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

**Sentinel's Instinct**
Once per long rest, when you would be hit by an attack you cannot see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that attack roll.

name: Greater Bracers of Archery
flavour: These leather bracers are tooled with images of hawks in flight, their eyes inlaid with tiny amber stones that catch the light. When you draw a bow, you feel the phantom grip of master archers guiding your aim.
description:
While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the longbow and shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

**Steady Aim**
Once per turn, when you miss with a ranged weapon attack using a bow, you can reroll the attack roll. You must use the new roll.

**Eagle's Eye**
You can see clearly up to 1 mile away, suffering no disadvantage on Perception checks due to distance.

name: Quiver of Ehlonna
flavour: Blessed by the goddess of forests, this quiver's interior holds far more than physics should allow. Reaching in, your fingers always find exactly what you need—as if the quiver itself anticipates the hunt.
description:
Each of the quiver's three compartments connects to an extradimensional space:

**Compartments**
• The shortest compartment can hold up to sixty arrows, bolts, or similar objects
• The midsize compartment holds up to eighteen javelins or similar objects
• The longest compartment holds up to six long objects, such as bows, quarterstaffs, or spears

You can draw any item the quiver contains as if doing so from a regular quiver or scabbard.

name: Arrow of Dragon Slaying
flavour: The arrowhead is forged from a dragon's own shed scale, turned against its kind. Faint draconic runes along the shaft pulse with barely contained fury—this arrow remembers what it once was, and seeks vengeance.
description:
An arrow of slaying is a magic weapon meant to slay a particular kind of creature. If a creature belonging to the type associated with an arrow of slaying takes damage from the arrow, the creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much extra damage on a successful one.

**Dragon Slayer**
This arrow is designed to kill dragons. Once it deals its extra damage, it becomes a nonmagical arrow.

name: Arrows +2 (Bundle of 10)
flavour: Each arrow is perfectly balanced, fletched with griffin feathers that self-correct in flight. The steel heads hold an edge that seems sharper than the smith's tools should have allowed.
description:
You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic arrows. Once an arrow hits or misses its target, the magic fades and it becomes a mundane arrow.

**Bundle**
This bundle contains 10 arrows.

name: Cloak of the Forest Guardian
flavour: Woven from leaves that never wither and dyed with moss that still grows, this cloak shifts its pattern with the seasons. In winter, it's bark and snow; in summer, dappled green light.
description:
While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in natural terrain. The cloak's color shifts to camouflage you.

**Nature's Embrace**
You can move through nonmagical difficult terrain without expending extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or similar hazards.

**Woodland Stride**
Once per long rest, you can cast Pass Without Trace without expending a spell slot.

name: Boots of the Tireless Tracker
flavour: The leather of these boots was cured in the footprints of a legendary huntsman who tracked his quarry across three continents. They carry echoes of that relentless pursuit.
description:
While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

**Tireless Pursuit**
You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures. Additionally, you can travel at a fast pace without suffering the normal -5 penalty to passive Wisdom (Perception).

**Endurance**
You can march for up to 12 hours before requiring a Constitution saving throw to avoid exhaustion.

name: Vineshot Bow
flavour: Living vines twist around the bow's limbs, flowering briefly each time you draw. The arrows it looses trail seeds that root on impact—nature claiming what was taken.
description:
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

**Entangling Shot**
Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with an arrow from this bow, you can cause grasping vines to erupt around the target. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be restrained until the end of your next turn.

**Nature's Quiver**
While holding this bow, you can use a bonus action to magically create one piece of ammunition. Arrows created this way vanish after 1 minute if not used.

name: Arrows +1 (Bundle of 20)
description:
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with these magic arrows. Once an arrow hits or misses its target, the magic fades and it becomes a mundane arrow.

**Bundle**
This bundle contains 20 arrows.

name: Hunter's Snare Kit
description:
This leather satchel contains materials to create 5 magical snare traps. As an action, you can set a snare in an unoccupied 5-foot square within 5 feet of you.

**Trigger**
The first creature that steps into the space must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

**Camouflage**
Snares are nearly invisible, requiring a DC 15 Perception check to spot.

name: Beast Caller's Whistle
description:
This carved bone whistle produces a sound only beasts can hear. You can use an action to blow the whistle and cast Animal Friendship (save DC 13) without expending a spell slot.

**Uses**
The whistle has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

**Wild Empathy**
While the whistle is on your person, you have advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

name: Arrows (Quiver of 20)
description: A leather quiver containing 20 standard arrows with steel broadheads.

name: Trail Rations (10 days)
description: Dried meat, hardtack, and nuts. Enough to sustain one person for 10 days.

name: Torches (Bundle of 10)
description: Wooden torches wrapped in oil-soaked cloth. Each burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius.

name: Hempen Rope (50 feet)
description: Strong hemp rope, useful for climbing, binding, or rescue operations. Can support up to 500 pounds.

name: Caltrops (Bag of 20)
description: Four-pronged metal spikes. Scatter them to cover a 5-foot square. Creatures entering must succeed on DC 15 Dex save or stop and take 1 piercing damage.

name: Oil Flask (5 flasks)
description: Flammable oil in ceramic flasks. Can fuel a lantern for 6 hours or be thrown as an improvised weapon (5 fire damage over 2 rounds if ignited).

name: Thieves' Tools
description: A set of lockpicks, a small mirror, narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Required for picking locks and disabling traps.

name: Healer's Kit
description: Bandages, salves, and splints. Has 10 uses. Can stabilize a dying creature without needing a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

name: Climber's Kit
description: Pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. When anchored, you can't fall more than 25 feet and can't fall to the bottom.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A four-pronged iron hook attached to a rope. Can be thrown to anchor to ledges, windows, or battlements.

name: Manacles
description: Iron restraints that bind a creature's wrists or ankles. Escaping requires DC 20 Dexterity check or DC 26 Strength check. Unlocking requires thieves' tools and DC 15 check.

name: Antitoxin (vial)
description: Drinking this grants advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. Does not cure existing poisoned condition.
